column4: Hi, I have aproblem with apache2, mysql phpmyadmin they all don't work due to trying to incorporate Rails and gems. I would like to start over with these  but by using lamp is that possible?
starting over is always possible.  remove the packages and reinstall.  Just be sure removal is done with --purge (or "complete removal in synaptic") to get rid of the configs as well
is lamp possible
apt-get remove --purge package name list goes here
ok got it
is there a phpmyadmin.conf file some where?
It'll be in your web directory, if its anywhere.
Or part of the DB
Use LAMP instead.  You dont need xampp on ubuntu, since you have package management
ok!!!
It does'nt appear to be on my machine?
What doesnt?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP  Its just a couple of commands, not a real package (because of the variety of configurations it could be)
lamp!!!
this is the error I get => tasksel: aptitude failed (100)
nothing seems to work reinstalling apache2 I get the error => apache2: Could not open configuration file /etc/apache2/apache2.conf: No such file or directory
You need to reinstall apache2.2-common to reinstall that file.  apache2 isn't enough
ok
still not working used what you requested => apache2: Could not open configuration file /etc/apache2/apache2.conf: No such file or directory
apache2: Could not open configuration file /etc/apache2/apache2.conf: No such file or directory
Did you completely remove apache2.2-common?
